title: Bug 6322 - All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: Bug 6322 - The 'All types' dialog displays obfuscated classes. JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d), etc.
OB: The 'All types' dialog is currently showing obfuscated classes, making it difficult to identify and select the desired classes. This affects the usability of the dialog.
EB: The obfuscated classes (e.g., a, a1, b, c, d) should be presented in a less prominent way, ensuring that non-obfuscated classes are more easily distinguishable. This will improve the user experience and make it simpler to locate and select the desired classes in the 'All types' dialog.
SR: Modify the 'All types' dialog to display obfuscated classes with reduced prominence. Ensure that non-obfuscated classes remain easily distinguishable for improved usability. Perform thorough testing to confirm that the changes have been implemented successfully and that the dialog functions as expected.
